page.title: 14ST.PETERS CHAPEL, TABLEY
page.content: ALTOGETHER THERE HAVE BEEN THREE CHAPELS ON THE TABLEY ESTATE,DURING THE TIME THAT IT HAS BELONGED TO THE LEICESTER-WARREN FAMILY. ST PETER'S CHAPEL WAS ORIGINALLY BUILT ON AN ISLAND IN A PIECE OF WATER KNOWN AS"THE MOAT." THE CHAPEL BECAME UNSAFE BECAUSE OF THE SALT MINING IN THE DISTRICT AND SO IT WAS MOVED AND REBUILT CLOSE TO TABLEY HOUSE.PARTS OF THE OLD MANOR WERE BUILT IN WITH THE CHAPEL,WHEN IT WAS MOVED. THIS PART OF THE CHAPEL IS KNOWN AS THE OLD HALL ROOM.THE FIRST FIREPLACE FROM THE OLD HALL IS IN THIS ROOM,TOGETHER WITH THE STAINED GLASS WINDOWS FROM THE BANQUETING HALL.THESE WINDOWS DEPICT THE COATS OF ARMS OF MEMBERS OF THE LEICESTER FAMILY AND MEDALLIONS DEPICTING SOME OF THE ENGLISH KINGS AND QUEENS.
